Package org.jvault.vault

Class ClassVault

java.lang.Object
org.jvault.vault.ClassVault
All Implemented Interfaces:
Vault<Class<?>>
@API public final class ClassVault extends Object implements Vault<Class<?>>
Receive the Class type as a parameter and returns the corresponding instance.

ClassVault can only be instantiated in the org.jvault.* package,
and actually you can't force instantiation of Vault without using Reflection.
This means that you should not instantiate ClassVault using Reflection.
To obtain ClassVault, see the ClassVaultFactory class.
Since:
0.1
See Also:
  • ClassVaultFactory

  • Method Details

    • inject

      public <R> R inject(Class<?> param)
      Description copied from interface: Vault
      Method of injecting beans into param.
      The package of param is included in the package list with access to the vault,
      and the injection succeeds only if the accesses paths of bean contains the package of param.

      Vault reads the declared @Inject in the param object and injects the corresponding beans,
      where the accesses of the beans must contain the package path of the param.

      If the param object is marked with @InternalBean,
      it finds the corresponding Bean in the Beans stored inside the Vault and returns an instance of param,
      or if not, it creates a new instance of param, injects the required Bean, and returns an instance of param.
      Specified by:
      inject in interface Vault<Class<?>>
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of return instance
      Parameters:
      param - The type of target to be injected beans, Vault will inject beans into the param.
      Returns:
      Returns an instance of the type received param.
      Throws:
      DisallowedAccessException - Occurs when the package in param is a package that does not have access to Vault, * or the Beans to be injected into param cannot be injected into the package in Param.
      See Also:
      • Inject
      • InternalBean
      • DisallowedAccessException
